fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Competition, Consumers, Energy, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Climate Action, Communication
inter_groups: Intergroup on Biodiversity, Climate Change and Sustainability
eu_initiatives:
There are a number of pieces of legislation, policies and files that have a very major impact on the water sector. 
 
The major ones are: 
- Water Framework Directive 
- Urban Wastewater Treatment Directive 
- Drinking Water Directive 
- Nitrates Directive 
- REACH 
 
Looking more widely, policies on energy, infrastructure, agriculture (eg CAP), all also have potential for very major impact on the water sector. 
 
Also, policies around finance, pricing, investment and economics also have a potential impact.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
We are members of Eureau - www.eureau.org  
 
We are members of the European Policy Centre - http://www.epc.eu/ 
 
We are members of the OECD Water Governance Initiative - http://www.oecd.org/env/watergovernanceprogramme.htm
goals__remit:
Water UK is the membership body for the UK water and sewerage companies. Water UK exists to help make better policies for the future of water. 
 
We work alongside policy makers in national and regional Governments in the UK and the European institutions.
relevant_communication: We run no more than two events a year in the Parliament. These are usually breakfast debates led by an MEP.
